de.esoco.gwt.server

Class CommandServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.AbstractRemoteServiceServlet
          • com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.RemoteServiceServlet
            • de.esoco.gwt.server.CommandServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.RemoteService, com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.SerializationPolicyProvider, CommandService, java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthenticatedServiceImpl

    public abstract class CommandServiceImpl
extends com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.RemoteServiceServlet
implements CommandService
    The base implementation of the CommandService interface. The interface method executeCommand(Command, DataElement) has a default implementation that dispatches command executions to subclass methods named handle <CommandName> by means of reflection. Therefore a subclass only needs to implement a corresponding handler method for each command it defines in it's public service interface.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                                                                                                                 throws ServiceException

        Executes a command in the service.

        Parameters:

      • checkCommandExecution

        protected <T extends de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>> void checkCommandExecution(Command<T,?> rCommand,
                                                                                      T rData)
                                                                               throws ServiceException
        Performs a checks whether the execution of a command is possible. This method can be overridden by subclasses to implement authentication or command (parameter) validations. To deny the command execution the implementation must throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        rCommand - The command that is about to be executed
        rData - The command argument
        Throws:
        ServiceException - If the command is not allowed to be executed

      • getApplicationName

        protected java.lang.String getApplicationName()
        Returns the name of the application this service belongs to. The default implementation returns the service name (without a trailing "ServiceImpl" if present). Subclasses may override this method to return a different name.
        Returns:
        The application name

      • getResource

        protected java.util.ResourceBundle getResource(java.lang.String sLocale)
        Returns the app resource for a certain locale.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getResourceBaseName

        protected java.lang.String getResourceBaseName()
        Returns the base name for the lookup of resource properties files. The default implementation returns getApplicationName().
        Returns:
        The resource base name

      • getResourcePath

        protected java.lang.String getResourcePath()
        Returns the server-side path to the resource files of this application. The default value is 'data/res' relative to the web application base path. If overridden the returned path must not end with a directory separator.
        Returns:
        The resource path

      • getResourceString

        protected java.lang.String getResourceString(java.lang.String sKey,
                                             java.lang.String sLocale)
        Returns a string from the application resources if such exist. If no resource for a given locale is found the corresponding string from the default resource is returned instead (if available).
        Parameters:
        sKey - The key identifying the resource
        sLocale - The locale to return the resource string for or NULL for the default resource
        Returns:
        The resource string or NULL if not found

      • handleException

        protected ServiceException handleException(java.lang.Throwable e)
        Logs, processes, and if necessary converts an exception. If the argument exception is a service exception it will be returned directly. All other exceptions will be converted into a service exception.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception to handle
        Returns:
        Always returns a service exception

      • readResourceFile

        protected java.util.ResourceBundle readResourceFile(java.lang.String sFileName)
        Tries to read a resource file with a certain name.
        Parameters:
        sFileName - The resource file name
        Returns:
        A new resource bundle instance from the given file or NULL if no matching file could be found
